lines.text: You try to tough it out with them, they'll lock you in a room somewhere and throw away the room.
[as he starts to take apart a nuclear bomb before it goes off]
Anybody want to make a bet?
Paul, did you build an atomic bomb?
Only a little one.
You mean I'm gonna die because some asshole didn't bring a pair of pliers?
What do you think you're doing?
Well I thought we'd start out with kissing, and then we might move onto the fancy stuff.
Sir, what about evacuation?
Evacuation? Of who?
The people.
Oh, you mean New York, Pennsylvania, Vermont, Canada... those people?
Look, he trusts me. Let me do it. I'll get it back. That's what we want, isn't it?
How do we know this thing won't be armed?
Armed?
That's right. He used the phrase, "I'm a terrorist." Here.

[reading transcript without sarcasm]
"No, I'm a terrorist. Haven't you been watching television?"
You people really live in your own world, don't you?
Well, we don't have the luxury of living in yours.
Why are you doing this?
Because life, my dear, is more than just freezing toads.
I never thought I'd say this to anybody, but I got to go get the atomic bomb out of the car.
[first lines]

Now, the beta synchrotron sends the electrons through this magnet which bends the course of them down to the reaction vessel. Stay away from that elbow joint. All right. Bran, you want to get that? Now, this is a tunable excimer laser. It's tuned to the exact resonance of the plutonium-239 that's in the reaction vessel down at that end. Now, I think we're all set. Hit it.
[last lines]
It's okay. I did something.
What happened?
Everything.
Tell you about it later. Let's get out of here.

This isn't funny. Do you know what this is like? It's like when you read about, I don't know, Anne Frank or something and you say to yourself, Jesus why didn't they do something. The whole world is collapsing. They just sat around, life as usual, maybe it'll go away, but it never goes away it only gets worse and nobody thinks about the future. What's the matter?
Who's Anne Frank?
If we get killed we won't have any future.
Of course we will. You always have a future.

[sighs]
Tell you the truth, I'd rather have ONE good dog than all that fancy equipment.

[sarcastically]
And tell your pals no funny stuff. I'm very tense, and there's no telling what I might do.
Paul?

[sotto voce]
Take it easy. You're fine.

[sarcastically]
No, I'm a terrorist. Haven't you been watching television?
Paul, what are you talking about?
Look, just let us t...
Paul?
Paul?
[Paul has driven off, leaving the payphone dangling]
